boardgame.name: Little Witch Nobeta
boardgame.description:
The little witch Norbeta is a 3D action shooting game.
Players will explore in unknown ancient castles and match different magic elements to fight against the soul!
The game uses a Japanese-style comfortable art style, but the battle is quite challenging.
To find weaknesses against the enemy, too casual attacks will fall into bitter fighting.
Grasp the timing of the attack, dodge, to gain the advantage in the battle.

boardgame.name: Classic Quest
boardgame.description:
Classic Quest is a cooperative game where a group of Heroes faces a fearsome dungeon randomly generated. It is designed so that novice players can get started with this game, but it develops a progressive difficulty that is challenging even for the most experienced ones.

It is a very old-school flavour designed, intended to transport us to the classic adventure that we could enjoy in our favorite fantasy novels or the best role-playing games.

Cooperation between players will always be key to succeed.

The dungeon map will be generated randomly, changing in every game, which favors replayability. The game will have an important number of furniture elements that will help you to dive into the adventur. Dungeon monsters will play automatically according to a protocol, easy to apply and consistent.

The exploration and combat mechanics are developed in a fluid and funny way. Our goal is that you will want to play Classic Quest over and over. No forgotten games on dusty shelves!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hellpoint: The Thespian Feast
boardgame.description:
The Thespian Feast is a free sequel-like chapter of Hellpoint, a dark and challenging action RPG where the line between science and occultism is unclear.

Many decades after the incident, someone finally manages to reach the forsaken space colony of Irid Novo. What the investigator finds, defies any form of reason, but a morbid obsession pushes him forward. If death doesn't come first, insanity will surely have the better of him.

boardgame.name: Pascal's Wager
boardgame.description:
Pascal's Wager is an action role playing game with the style of dark fantasy. The game provides its players with top-notch picture quality and a feast for the senses that the mobile platform has never had before. In the game, the world is shrouded by dark mist, where light is dim and mysterious. People there become lunatic, and nobody knows the secrets behind that.

Players can play multiple characters to experience the strong storyline and reveal various hidden areas of the map. Along the way, they will fight unbelievable enemies, confront epic bosses, and embrace overwhelming death and truth. All the while, they'll be engrossed by a magnificent soundtrack performed by a world-class orchestra.

boardgame.name: Egress
boardgame.description:
Egress is a multiplayer souls-like PvP arena in a lovecraftian universe. Choose one of many characters with unique features and gameplay. Fight on the streets of Insmouth with monsters, madmen and other adventurers!
Decide who you want to support - desperate Explorers, crazy Bandits, manic Mercenaries or brave Guards!
Find powerful mystical artifacts, understand what is happening and determine the fate of this world!
But do not forget that your true enemy is sleeping in the depths of the sea...

boardgame.name: David Coulthard's Kartzee
boardgame.description:
David Coulthard's Kartzee is a fun fast racing game where players have to manage their dice and tactics to be the first player to get both of their teams cars ahead of DC.

Designed by David J. Mortimer as a commission for Cooper Tires as a promotional item in the line of their Ambassador David Coulthard merchandise.

A game is played over rounds until one player ends their turn with both their cards in front of DC. At the start of a round DC moves at his current speed, which will change during the game.

Each player in turn order then performs their turn by rolling 3 dice, they must pick 1 dice for each car and then the third is used as a special tactic for one car to slip stream from a distance, overtake a car in front, nail the corners this move or to collect tactic cubes depending on what has been rolled. Tactic cubes let players manipulate the rolls on future turns. At the end of a turn the players cars will cruise up behind a car in front of them.

Managing these rolls and the numbers used for cars verses tactics is critical to success because if you enter a corner too fast you'll skid to a halt and lose your momentum and if you can get ne of your cars to punch a hole in the air for their team mate you speed will increase.

A game quick enough that you can learn to play and finish a game whilst your tires are fitted!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: What's Your Number?
boardgame.description:
Reveal what your friends really think about the questionable things you’ve always wondered about.

Your friend secretly rates how they feel about one of 216 topics on a scale of 1-100. All other players then guess that players rating: aka their “number.”

Your friend’s number is revealed at the end of the round and everyone learns who knows that friend best… and what they really think about their topic.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Outlands Mission: I've Soiled My Plants
boardgame.description:
I've Soiled My Plants is an OUTLANDS mission where both players have to 'sow' a seed in a patch of 'Spice Enriched Soil', wait for the seed to germinate and then take the Sapling back to Prof. Maria Topaisz.
A little spot of gardening never hurt anyone...its the bullets whizzing past your ears that cause the damage.

So a reasonable simple and straight forward mission that experienced players shouldn't have a problem completing on the 2nd or 3rd attempt.
That's why I've Soiled my Plants has 3 levels of difficultly with better rewards for completing each increasingly difficult mission. This is a new method that adds some goals to a standard mission.

The three levels are Normal, Heroic and Master.


Normal Level:- Is the base mission. This has already been described above.
Heroic Level:- Has the same basic outline of the Normal Mission but now the players will need to harvest the Saplings before the harsh environment of the badlands kills the plants.
Master Level:- Taking Normal and Heroic levels. With the added bonus of getting the 'Harvest Saplings' of the game table in a certain amount of ACTIONS.


Each 'Level' offers new and existing OUTLAND Players a different challenge. Of course the rewards for completing each 'Level' have been increased to match the mission type.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wild West Circus
boardgame.description:
Wild West Circus - it is one of the kind role-playing immersive game. An untold story where you will be immersed and forced to make tough decisions to survive and keep the circus intact ;)

Grimtown - it is a little town in Wild West where your circus comes. You think run circus is simple? Think again. Escaped animals, blackmailed by local sheriff, paying for “protection” is just a start. Native Americans are not happy with the way you go around towns – prepare to fight them off.

Successful? Great, since now you have to solve love triangle. Finally you get a secret note that there might be buried treasure in town. Will you pursue the hint or is this just a prank to keep you from things that are really important? Maybe making moonshine will be more profitable in times of “dry” season? ?

To play this game you will need a smart phone – so you could hear all whispers and rumors. Without your “street” knowledge it will be nearly impossible to solve mysteries and get on the good side with town’s people.

Brace yourself into an adventure of your lifetime!

You and your fellow "managers" will have to work hand in hand in order to achieve the best result possible. The better and more thoughtful your decision are the better score you will achieve. Compare these numbers in the app with other players and see who will be the best at running Circus In the old West.

—description from the designer

(Choju-Okushon)
boardgame.description:
(Choju-Okushon) (ANIMAL AUCTION) is a Japanese card game with an unusual auction.

Bidding, card drafting, and set collection!!!

Make a successful bid for slightly rare animal at a bit of a curious auction!!

Each player participates in a total of eight auctions during a single session, and collects animals that has its own victory point by bidding with each other.

Players may obtain honorable titles when they collect up certain set of animals according to their requirement.

A mechanic in this game which worthy of special mention is the moneys players bid are spent immediately and will not go back to the bidder. Each player decides their bidding price secretly, and reveals at the same time. Then, each player but the lowest-bidding player will take one card from the auction lot.

The lowest-bidding player cannot take any card from this lot, but instead they take all of the money spent in that bidding!

What a bizarre auction!

Ladies and gentlemen, please try this peculiar auction by yourself!

×××
















publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Fatal Flaw
boardgame.description:
Fatal Flaw is a dice-rolling real-time battle game for 2-4 players published by Button Shy Games and sent to Patreon Backers of it's Board Game of the Month Club. It consists of 4 character cards and a PDF of rules page. Player will need to provide up 2 8 dice and 40 tokens or chips in order to play.

Players each select a character and begin rolling their dice, when they think their dice are both higher than another player's they can call Hit, the game is paused and the hit is resolved. There are special rolls for blocks, heals, and special moves for each character. If a player gets 6 hits against them, they have to contend with their fatal flaw and play at a disadvantage. If a player gets 10 hits against them they are out. Last one standing wins.

boardgame.name: Universal Rule: Character Pack #1
boardgame.description:
This 6-card expansion adds 6 alien races to the game, only 2 of which are used in a given game. Players, in addition to normal actions, may attempt to ally with, or vanquish, the alien races. Allied aliens give you an ongoing effect that modifies other actions in the game, while vanquishing the aliens prevents allied effects and gains you victory points.


These alien homeworld cards are placed in the center of the table and represent the aliens that are currently in place on specific planets. If a player tried to inhabit one of those locations, they must either align with the alien and take a special power for the rest of the game -OR- vanquish the alien to gain additional stars.

boardgame.name: Universal Rule: Duplicity
boardgame.description:
This expansion is included in the base game set Universal Rule: Second Wave.


A 6-card expansion to the Universal Rule family of games. This expansion adds 6 new planets to explore that adds additional rules and ways to score.

The main theme of this expansion is cards that double things.



Escalating Edge


Planets

Antedock
Fixtau
Mannisoni
Piscius VI
Wachu
Zeffe



Released in the July 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

boardgame.name: Universal Rule: Attack! Attack!
boardgame.description:
This expansion is included in the base game set Universal Rule: Second Wave.


A 6-card expansion to the Universal Rule family of games. This expansion adds 5 new planets to explore and the Escalating Edge card that adds additional rules and ways to score.

The main theme of this expansion is cards that emphasize attack.



Escalating Edge

Pospars
Ascore

boardgame.description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Normandy '44 - Red Devils of the Orne

This is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the the fighting of the paratroops from the 9th Parachute Battalion (British) and 1st Canadian Parachute Battalions, 6th Airborne Division east of the Orne River in early June 1944.

The book includes twelve scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns.

This book is fully compatible with the other four books in the SkirmishCampaigns Normandy series (First Hours, Heroes of Omaha and Panzer Lehr and Monty's EPSOM).

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information and a map on the campaign east of the Orne River. This book also features an annotated bibliography of sources.

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Lennie
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Of Mice and Men by John Steinbeck, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club February 2018 package.

Lennie:
(1) Forget: Take the action of any face down card.
(2) Strength: Roll the die. If you roll a 1, 2, or 3 you may stall all of the powers. Nothing happens if you roll a 4, 5, or 6.

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Bernard
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Brave New World by Aldous Huxley, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club October 2018 package.

Bernard:
(1) Rise: Move a power token and a progress token each forward two spaces.
(2) Fall: Move a progress token back 2 spaces and another forward 2 spaces.

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Guy
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club August 2018 package.

Guy:
(1) Pride: Take the lane 1 action three times, then move it to the end and flip it over.
(3) Burn: Lose up to 3 stamina to progress one space for each stamina lost.

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Tom
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Grapes of Wrath by John Steinbeck, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club November 2018 package.

Tom:
(3) Parole: Restart your turn.
(3) Vitality: Place a stall token on your Stamina. At any point you can move it to a power.

boardgame.name: Banned Books: Atticus
boardgame.description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club September 2018 package.

Atticus:
(1) Represent: Take the action of a lane where a power is further than the progress.
(2) Equality: Move a progress token to the same space as a power token.

boardgame.name: Dwarf Invasion
boardgame.description:
A 9-Card microgame from Button Shy games for 1-3 players.

In a reversal of roles, the aliens are the ones being invaded! In Dwarf Invasion you will try to destroy the alien hive that was simply minding its own business, until you came along to rob them of their precious minerals. Watch out, as they will fight back!

Players will need to supply up to 12 6-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Tornado Chase
boardgame.description:
Become the best storm chaser and jockey for position while avoiding being swept away in the storm. Let the Veteran Driver get you in the storm's path so that the Anxious Radar Tech can drop weather sensors at just the right moment. Just be sure to get out of path of the infamous F5 tornado!

Tornado Chase is a 9-card microgame from Button Shy for 2-4 storm chasers.

Players try to score the most acclaim points before the Tornado reaches the final space.


Released in the June 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

boardgame.name: Micro Drift
boardgame.description:
Nanodaption of Turbo Drift.


Description by the designer:

Based on Turbo Drift by Rob Cramer, as part of the September 2017 "Boardgame of the Month."

Based on one of my earliest attempts at game design, Micro Drift has players swerving wildly around an arena to collect a set of four flags. Grab a boost or chevron and watch out for oil. After moving, you steer by rotating a quadrant of the board, which rearranges the paths and can force your opponents to head in different directions.

This comes with 4 two-sided cards and a rule sheet. Cut out the tokens and fold the Car standees to bring the game to life.

boardgame.name: Bread and Circuses
boardgame.description:
A 3-card microgame for exactly 3 Roman Nobles out for themselves in a time of crisis.

The great empire is crumbling.

Players are nobles doing what nobles do best in a crisis - milking the plebeians for as much money as possible before fleeing to their country homes. Make more money by giving plebeians a scarcer resource.

Consists of 3 cards. A scoring method (pen and paper) is needed and should be provided by the players.


Released in the October 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: Laser Battlefield
Lazer Battlefield
boardgame.description:
Two recruits face-off in a war tactics simulation, codenamed Mirror Battlefields.

These new tools will reflect lazers and allow new angles to reach the enemy.

But, as with any emerging warfare tech, we expect the enemy is working on their own version.

A 9-card microgame for 1-2 players (solo rules available), with 2 ship cards and 7 battlefield cards.


In this game, each player takes control of a ship skirting the outside of a battlefield grid. Initially, the grid is full of unknown cards, but as they are hit with your laser, they are revealed and can be moved to help you attack your opponent. First player to hit their opponent twice wins.

I've also added a Solo variant where a pesky drone is racing you around the battlefield. Can you destroy it before it gets home?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 3 Lands or King
boardgame.description:
A little game of conquest.
Two Houses against each other, one kingdom to conquer!

In this 8 card microgame, 2 players each vie to conquer three of the five lands, or become king (by conquering 2 lands with a total value of 18 or more). The first to do so wins.

Each land battle takes place as players add one of 5 army types to the land, then maneuvers them using their unique movement abilities to attempt to be first to get 3 armies in a row.
boardgame.boardgameversion: Print & Play Mint Tin Design Contest edition

boardgame.name: SkirmishCampaigns: Poland '39 The Black Brigade
boardgame.description:
Poland '39-The Black Brigade
On September 1, 1939 the German army invaded Poland and started the greatest war the earth had ever seen. Contrary to popular myth, the Polish army fought with determination and skill. Poland managed to hold out nearly as long against Germany as France and Britain did a year later.

This book traces the saga of the brave Polish 10th Mechanized Division, the "Black Brigade" from the opening days of invasion to the fall of Poland.

Elements of the intrepid Black Brigade eventually withdrew from Poland and formed the nucleous of the Polish 1st Armored Division that would in 1944 close the Falaise Gap and play a key role in the capture of thousands of German troops.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the Polish Campaign of 1939.

Includes:

10 Scenarios,
4 Campaigns.


—description from the publisher

Iron Cross: WWII Wargaming in Miniature
Overlord: Wargame Rules for the Normandy Campaign June-August 1944

boardgame.name: Tsukuyumi: Full Moon Down Dark Crusade
boardgame.description:
When the Marduk Order started their offensive against Tsukuyumi, the boldest and most renown knights of the Order were sent on the hardest mission in the history of the great battles against the wyrms: venture into the innerst of the moon and finish what the Kami Hunters began.

Whilst their brothers of the KG 03 were send to fight the Oni from the ground, the KG 01, were deployed directly on the moon 3000 kilometers above the ocean soil. From there, the 5 dragonslayers began their journey into the core of the moon.

Buried in the bodies of their fallen foes in their pierced battlesuits, the knights of the KG 01 were imbued with Tsukuyumi's power and became Oni. But due to their training and their faith they were able to resist the transformation and keep their own will. With their new powers they patched their battlesuits with organic mass and ascended from the inner core of the moon. Half Oni and half knight. Ready to rain havoc on whoever steps in the way of their crusade. Their DARK CRUSADE.

Playstyle

The Dark Crusade are immensely powerful. But like the KG 03 they only have few units. In fact they have even less units then their righteous brothers, namely three.

As the Dark Crusade are kind of Oni themselves they can to certain amount interact and even control the Oni.
All Oni adjacent to Grendel count as units of the Dark Crusade and can be moved by the player and can even perform attacks.

As long as Lilith is in play, areas with Oni in them can not be conquered and finally every area Samael enters gains the Tsukuyumi area property.

Oh, and I almost forgot Baal. But he just sits in his drop pod (The KG 01 homezone) and shoots everybody who comes near him.
Like the KG 03 the Dark Crusade wants to dictate the pace of the game right from the start and center the attention on the moon and areas that a worth more VP.

The Dark Crusade really are the new powerhouse in town.

Did I mention that Grendel has an atomic bomb for a heart?

No? And guess what, he can blow it up, inflicting tons of damage! Literally TOOOONS of damage.

So are you ready to expose yourselves to Tsukuyumi's pheromones and step inside a tainted battlesuit to bring wrath upon your opponents?

listing.notes: Shipment world: 7,50 Safe Shipment and take a look at my other promos.

boardgame.name: 13 Fiends: A Baker's Dozen of Devils
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

There are powers in the world who can be called upon by those willing to pay their price. These beings barter wealth and power, beauty and prestige for loyalty, service and in many cases, for souls. While they are less than gods, every devil in this collection comes with established rites and rituals, cults, areas of influence and enough lore that they could find a place somewhere in your campaign. Whether it's as a part of the scenery, a potential antagonist, or even the force the party turns to when they get desperate... that's up to you.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here is an example fiend:

Nershan, The Vengeful One

The world is full of faiths that instill their followers with the value of peace. Faiths who extol the virtue of leaving the wicked to find their own reward for their unrighteous actions. However, the thirst for revenge is not something that everyone can put aside when they or those they love have been hurt or slighted. Those who are willing to turn down dark paths, and to sell their souls to repay those who wronged them, will find Nershan waiting to embrace them.

One page is the front cover and one the front matter.

boardgame.name: 100 Encounters for Fantasy Mountains (PFRPG)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Mountains can be dangerous places in and of themselves, being home to such as mud- and rockslides, avalanches, high winds, freezing conditions and potential falls. This supplement has 100 different encounters that can be used to add extra detail to a mountain journey or as a source of adventure hooks. Some are potentially useful, some are potentially hazardous and some are simply odd.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Dense trees hide a sudden drop-off from view. The trees suddenly disappear, revealing the top of a steep cliff. Travellers who are going through the trees too fast may not have enough time to stop (characters travelling at a speed faster than 20 feet must make a DC 10 Reflex or DC 10 Acrobatics check to stop in time; those who fail must make a DC 20 Reflex save to grab onto a root or outcropping to avoid falling off the cliff).

Dying trees cover the mountain’s slope here. Each tree has had the bark stripped off the trunk to a height about 6' above the ground. (DC 10 Knowledge (nature) or DC 10 Survival check to determine that this damage is animal in origin.)

Far above, what appears to be a stone balcony protrudes from the side of a cliff.

Four figures are making their way up the mountain's slope. They initially appear to be quite close, until it is realised (DC 10 Perception) that they are actually very large and some distance away.

Freshly uprooted trees and scars in the mountain's slope show where a recent landslide has ploughed through the treeline.

One page is the front cover, one the front matter, one ads and one the Open Game License.

The supplement is also available in a system-neutral version. You do not need to buy both versions.

boardgame.name: Larvapocalypse: Flesh Pit Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Flesh Pit Expansion features the 2" Immortal Flesh Pit Monster and a 4x4 Bloody Flesh board tile. The Immortal Monster awakens at the sound of combat and poses a deadly threat to any who enter the Flesh Pit.

This is the first Larvapocalypse expansion to feature new gameplay mechanics, and the Immortal Monster figure is the first 2" figure released for the game.

boardgame.name: Reggae Revolution
boardgame.description:
In the year 2266, the world is controlled by a facist police state. Peace, love, unity, and respect have all been made illegal. Finding the relics of reggae in the ruins of the old world, a circle of youths rediscovers the power of music. They plan to coordinate an enormous underground dance party to return the message of nonviolent resistance back to the people.

Reggae Revolution is a cooperative card game for 1 to 6 players.

Players work together to bring the message of peace and love back to the world. In the game are four suits: peace, love, unity, and respect. Players try to use these cards to collect sets in the score area to win the game. But, at the beginning of each player's turn, a villain card pops out and makes the player discards all cards of a suit that the villain supresses. Instead of fighting the villains, the players must sway them by giving them cards from their deck. If the player does not have enough, the villain stays in play. As the villains stack up, the players must discard more and more cards from their hand. If the villains ever supress all four suits, peace, love, unity, and respect, then no one has any cards and the villains win the game!

Fight the power! Join the resistance! And bring peace and love back to the people!

boardgame.name: Battle for the Island
boardgame.description:
Set on a golden island you must try to outsmart your opponent in a strategic battle that starts right from the very beginning

The island is set on a 12 x 12 playing field. Each player starts the game with one carrier pad and ten tiles which consist of three different characters. The tiles are also reversible, on one side you have your combat unit and the other side is a number that represents that characters firing range. You can choose either side of the tile to play your battle. Plus there’s ten communal obstacle block tiles.

Game play
All characters move around the island in the same manner by the roll of a dice which is numbered 0-5. The number rolled on the dice will determine the amount of moves a character can advance to. You will have the option to move your character forward in a straight line, and the option to change direction to the left or right on each move. To remove your opponents characters from the island, your character has to be facing forward towards your intended target in a direct line, and the shot has to be an exact hit matching your characters fire range. An exciting part of the game is the fact that your carrier pad, not only carries your reinforcements but it can also, move along the edge of the island. Now your characters will be able to be launched onto the island from a different position.

Setup
The action starts as soon as you start setting up for the battle ahead.
First take turns in placing one obstacle block at a time onto the island until all ten tiles are on the island, during the battle these can be used for defence or can be activated for attack. Carry on taking turns until you have placed any five of your ten characters onto the island, at this stage you will be keeping a close eye on what your opponent is up to. Your remaining five characters will be placed onto your carrier pad of which is located just off the edge of the island, this is where your reinforcements are located during the battle.

PLAY YOUR TURN
After the setup play will now continue by the roll of the dice.
This is where the action gets real on your turn you will have the option to remove any intended target, providing a direct hit has been established. This action can be done before you move your character and after and as many times as you wish. All movement is determined by the roll of the dice, after which many options will be available to you; move to attack, elude attack, blocking your enemy from movement, activating obstacle blocks, risk taking, launching reinforcements and moving your carrier pad. On your turn you must all ways make your play using the entire number shown on the dice. Failure to do this will result in you losing a character so play well and try not to get yourself trapped. When your happy with all your actions played, you will now pass play over to your opponent who in turn will play their turn.

Carry on taking turns until a player wins by removing all ten of his opponent's characters to become the new ruler.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Night Class: Episode Two
Night Class: Remastered! Episode 2: Extra Credit
boardgame.description:
In this unique roll & write game, you become a superhero-in-training. Customize your hero each round, while infiltrating the enemy's location and neutralizing the threats. But hurry, time is ticking and you might not be able to save everyone!

Looks like the neighborhood has some new muscle in town. Led by a trigger-happy criminal known as Miss Never, the crooks have already ransacked two local banks. They messed up tonight, because class was cancelled, and your night just opened up.

Object of the Game: Defeat Miss Never, her right-hand man, Edge, and the ghostly villain Wraith. You must also recover all of the stolen money. You lose if you cross out your last Stamina point, the public trust drops too low (all squares filled in), or Miss Never escapes.

boardgame.name: Night Class: Episode Three
Night Class: Remastered! Episode 3: Teacher's Pet
boardgame.description:
In this unique roll & write game, you become a superhero-in-training. Customize your hero each round, while infiltrating the enemy's location and neutralizing the threats. But hurry, time is ticking and you might not be able to save everyone!

Dr. Killian Switch, the world-renowned engineer, had been missing for days, before returning with an army of robots. His demands were short and dark—surrender the city to his control or face annihilation at the hands of his minions. Well, former teacher or no, this professor needs to be dismissed. Now hopefully you can stop this madman, because a failing grade is the least of your concerns!

Object of the Game: Defeat Killian Switch, Nemetron and EVE-209. You lose if you cross out your last Stamina point, or the public’s Trust drops too low (all squares filled in).

boardgame.name: Drive Like Hell
boardgame.description:
Drive Like Hell was a finalist in Button Shy Game's September Challenge where all 18 cards were required to be identical!

With your recently rescued lover in tow, you now flee the minions of Hell, and the Devil himself. The creature from the pit will own your lover’s soul unless you can reach the sanctity and safety of Saint Joseph's Cathedral. So shift your car into high gear and Drive Like Hell!

Object of the Game: To win the game you must reach the Saint Joes location without The Devil reaching you, having your vehicle receive four points of damage or having a Fiend reach your location.

boardgame.name: Skirmish '90: Modern Wargames Rules 1915-2005
boardgame.description:
Rules designed to deal with small unit actions between 1915 and 1995.
Aimed at Platoon or company level with limited air and armour support.
They use non-linear ground scale, varying from 1:400 at short distances to 1:2000 at the maximum envisaged distance. In effect accentuating the role of small-arms & other infantry weapons.
Turns are simultaneous and in general the order set out in the Bound should be followed.
Reaction rolls are there to make the unit leaders the centre of the game.
Allow hidden movements in the presence of an empire

boardgame.name: Warlock!
boardgame.description:
A Game Inspired by the Early Days of British Tabletop Gaming

Form the introduction:

Warlock! is a rules-light roleplaying game that aims to emulate the feeling of old-school British tabletop games of wondrous and fantastical adventure.

Warlock! looks to reproduce the play style of its illustrious predecessors but in a light, quick and simple manner, with a consistent rules set that is easily hackable and adaptable as desired.

boardgame.name: Flex6 Core Version
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Flex6 is a universal system for pen-and-paper roleplaying games, with emphasis in consistent, streamlined rules, quick action resolution and high character customisation. It was designed from the ground up with the intention of providing a roleplaying rules framework that would enable players to design truly individual characters and emphasise the meaningful differences making them unique. To this end, one of the key concepts of Flex6 is dynamic abilities that can interact with each other and allow the player the freedom to determine his character’s strong and weak points.

This core version contains all the basic concepts and mechanics of Flex6 as well as a small selection of generic character abilities. Although it is not detailed enough to be used straight out of the box for anything but the simplest games, the core version serves as a demonstration of what Flex6 is and what it can do. A very simple game setting called “Bloodhunt” is included towards the end of the book to show how the base system can be expanded to serve the needs of a particular game.

boardgame.name: Stellar Drift
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Stinson spun the chair around to face the captain.

“That’s it,” he said. “The tanks are empty.”

Brist nodded, her mouth dry. The deltaV readout on her station had already written that epitaph for her in its single glowing digit: zero.

“What are our chances?”

Stinson shrugged. “We’re coming in way too steep. The hull is rated to 4G; we’re going to pull six during re-entry. The heat shield is good to about 1500 degrees; we’re going to double that.

“So, either the hull will break apart and kill us, or the heat shield will fail and kill us or the G forces will crush our hearts and kill us.”

“You’re a real optimist,” Brist said. “Everything could hold together until we’re moving slowly enough to fire up the scoops and use the air as propellant for a landing.”

Stinson shrugged again, turning back to his pilot’s station. “Me,” he said, “I’m hoping the heat shield fails first. A quick death from 2500 degree plasma is far preferable to the lingering pain of your heart bursting from 100 kilos of ribs pressing down on it.”
boardgame.rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

boardgame.name: The Center Space (1st Ed.)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Beginning of a New Age

Some time in the 23rd Century, a series of events would take place that would change humanity forever. Not since the dawn of the Axial Age (some 2,000 years before) had such a cultural and social revolution taken place.

It was a time of chaos and confusion. Events were taking place that neither Science or the Old Religions could explain. The invention of both cold fusion and artificial intelligence (A.I.) provided the ability to travel at speeds close to that of light, allowing the colonization of other planets. A new species of Human began to appear (Homo Psionic), Humans able to manifest powers such as telepathy and telekinesis. At the same time, humanity was in the midst of its third World War (now known as the Corporate Wars), between the mega-corporations (now ruling most of Earth) and the Free States.

It was at this time the Great Teachers appeared. Two of them being Homo Sapiens, one being Homo Psionic and the others extraterrestrial. Their teachings would bring about a new religious awakening, uniting humanity.

boardgame.name: Sword Spirit
boardgame.description: Famous sword, spiritual realm after the death of the awakening. Where is the owner? How did Gorgeous architecture and The Mysterious Island become a ruin? What happened before the destruction? All doubts will be revealed in the footsteps of the players.

boardgame.name: Gujian 3
boardgame.description:
Gujian 3 is a mass 3D single-person RPG developed by Aurogon Info & Tech (Shanghai), a subsidiary of Wangyuan Shengtang. As the latest hit of the Gujian series, it boasts more free and smooth combat experience with its full real-time combat system. This generation expands the world of Gujian based on previous works. The vivid and beautiful graphic style brings the scenery, people and stories from an ancient time to life and truly makes the game world alive!
The story background of Gujian 3 is a fantasy world built upon the elements of ancient China, therefore, players will experience rich cultural context all over the game, adding daring and limitless imagination to this oriental fantasia.

boardgame.name: Organizations, Agencies and Secret Societies (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Organizations, Agencies and Secret Societies, a supplement for the 1948 Campaign Setting. This file contains nearly 50 unique organizations, government agencies, and political ideologies that are prevalent in most early 20th century RPGs. If you are not planning to use this supplement with the 1948 Campaign Setting, feel free to modify or adjust these groups to fit your particular style of game. If you plan to use this supplement with the 1948 setting, understand that these are merely descriptions of allegiances that the players can select for their characters. This is essentially “player information.” More campaign oriented information for the Game Master regarding some of these groups will be included in forthcoming files.

boardgame.name: Goth Prom
boardgame.description:
A One-Shot About Love and Dread

From the introduction:

You and your friends are going to... sigh... prom. Ugh. But you've decided to make the most of it. After all, your crush will be there, and this might be your only chance to let them know how you really feel. Thing is, you're not like the other kids, and tonight is a bad luck night.

boardgame.description: Issue 2 of Zeit-Aus!, it includes stories of campaigns, workshops and an interview with Uwe Körner.

boardgame.name: Tore
boardgame.description:
Tore is a combinatorial abstract strategy game for two players, Red and Blue. Each player controls a set of sufficiently many stones. The game is played on a hexagonal board; hex-9 and above are recommended for competitive play, while hex-6 provides a quick game for rapid players and beginners. Experimenting with the shape and size of the board yields many playable variants. It is best enjoyed on an interactive board, automatically keeping track of the score.

A cell “sees” a stone if it is the closest one in any of the six directions. An empty cell is “dominated” by a player if it sees more of his stones than his opponent’s.

Red begins with a single action, then players alternate taking turns of two actions each. An action consists of placing a single stone on any empty cell not dominated by either player. The game ends when all empty cells are dominated. The player who dominates more cells is the winner.

The creation of Tore was inspired by Dale Walton’s Shaka.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Hasting's Party
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The Hasting's Party is a celebration of triumph against the elements and of
survival in one of the most inhospitable places for mankind to live.
It is a moment to remember the community and sacrifice it takes to survive
in a harsh world, but is there something more sinister beneath the surface?

Hasting's Party features...
Details for a warped cannibal Mardi Gras celebration
Okina a powerful winter fae
Winter Elementals
A map of Wasatch
A new location to doom your players with
Die drop chart to add re-playability
Details for its locations and residents
Wilderness encounters
Exposure rules
Survival horror
and much more.

Hasting's Party is survival horror and investigative adventure
for 3rd to 6th level characters.

It is designed for old school elf games and is easily compatible with most
d20-based Roleplaying Games.

boardgame.name: Savage Abilities Volume 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Advantageous Abilities: Savage Abilities Volume 2 includes twenty-four abilities. Frighten your PCs with abilities like War Cry, add a little uncertainty with Blinding Blade or Festering Wound, or give them something to worry about with a Staggering Onslaught. No matter your choice, this PDF is sure to make flavourful and effective NPCs.

boardgame.name: The Complete Averaach
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Averaach is a crystal that occurs throughout Eldoria as a result of periodic strikes by minute meteorites that manifest themselves during the Span of Daukas in the March of Fire. The meteors strike the ground and, in some cases, combine with the dominant elements in the area and form different kinds of crystals and gems. These are known as Averaach and have various (and often dangerous) effects when in close proximity to magic.

This release provides you with an update on Averaach and includes three new varieties that have not appeared in print – Diamond, Opal and Obsidian..

boardgame.name: The Hunters A.D. 2114: Shiptown
owcy A.D. 2114: Shiptown
boardgame.description:
What secrets are hidden inside the wreck of the old tanker? What lurks in the darkness of holds and cabins sealed shut for decades?
—description from the publisher

Shiptown is a second expansion for The Hunters A.D. 2114.

listing.notes: Box opened.

boardgame.name: Calidar: A Players' Guide to Meryath
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The perfect complement to CAL1 "In Stranger Skies," this supplement describes the Kingdom of Meryath from different points of view of particular interest to player characters.

PG1 provides a summary of Meryath's geography, climate, and economy. It reveals the attitudes of its inhabitants toward other cultures, and their bloodlines.

It explains how to create characters for this setting, focusing on new character classes, such as dragon slayers, Draconic knights, and Calidar minstrels.

Packed with fun and useful information, this guide also features game mechanics for epic heroes, local cults, a travel guide, and a convenient list of festivals.

It is an invaluable tool for referees to introduce Meryath to players, as well as a handy summary for anyone who does not own (yet) CAL1.

boardgame.name: Entropic Science Fiction
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Entropic Science Fiction is a sci-fi tabletop role-playing game powered by the Entropic Gaming System 2.0 System Reference Document. It can accommodate all types of sci-fi settings and styles using the same set of mechanics. Designed with the principle of allowing maximum flexibility with fewer rules, characters can vary widely while still retaining the depth of their background, providing players with the means to translate their character concepts into something fully usable on the tabletop.

Using an escalating dice mechanic, from d4 through d12, a combination system that allows Skills to be combined with different Abilities to produce any possible action, character Qualities that can be used in-game to produce bonuses through Hero Points, and very flexible mechanics for combat and Talents (magic), ESF keeps the rules medium while presenting players with more options and flexibility!

Whether it’s space opera, post-apocalyptic, space fantasy, steampunk, or cyberpunk, Entropic Science Fiction can handle them all! Powered by the Open Gaming License, fans and Third Party Publishers can take advantage of the simple mechanics to make ESF THEIR game.

Entropic Science Fiction is a complete standalone core rulebook built from the EGS 2.0 SRD. It does not require any other book to be playable.

Entropic Science Fiction includes:

Ten unique PC cultures to choose from.
An expanded list of Qualities compared to the SRD.
A large collection of sci-fi equipment.
Magic as science characte concepts.
An expanded list of Talents compared to the SRD.
GM guidance for creating games and missions.
Example settings and missions.
A small bestiary.
... and more!

boardgame.name: Torpor
boardgame.description:
The worst has occurred! While traveling through empty space in Cryonic Torpor, the PIN Drive responsible for Quantum Pinning your vessel to a point in time, allowing near instantaneous travel across light years, has failed. As a failsafe the ship has deactivated your Torpor, meaning you are slowly waking up with only moments to fix the drive and renew your Torpor before the low levels of life support on the ship can no longer keep you conscious. You must Repair the Drive while manufacturing enough Refrigerant to renew Torpor, all while providing yourself with enough Oxygen and Nutrient to keep moving until you succeed.

Torpor is a single-player roll-and-write in which a player will assign up to five dice to various tasks on their board. Dice must be assigned to both Survival categories (Oxygen and Nutrient) every turn, and may also be assigned to buy Upgrades (such as an additional health or dice) and Repairs, which are needed to win the game. If you can repair both Refrigerant and Drive before running out of Health, you have won the game!

While rolling the dice you may reroll any dice in matching pairs, triples, etc. This provides strategy as you attempt to obtain the dice you will need each turn, and an element of risk as you may decide to reroll "good" dice in order to obtain the pairs you need to reroll "bad" dice. There is also strategy in deciding where to assign your dice, and when to intentionally take damage and work on repairs instead.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Little Red's Guide to Wizard Wounds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Turning Magic Scars into Magic Power

The wonders of magical medicine never cease, but however well healers learn to put us back together, the magical arts will always find more grievous ways to cause wounds. Unfortunate accidents result in what are called “wizard wounds”; terrible wounds that can never fully be healed or treated thanks to lingering magical interference. These so-called “wizard wounds” (or “wiz-wounds”) come with a small boon though: they grant the user the innate ability to replicate the spell that scarred them if they survive.

Included:

Simple rules for using wizard wounds in your Pathfinder 1st Edition, Pathfinder 2nd Edition, Starfinder, or 5th Edition.
Various ways to implement wizard wounds into your game! (Everything from unrestricted use to make your players a little stronger to a count-down to your demise!)
